comment.text:
SIMB is a short walk from my front door and yet I don't nearly come to visit as much as I would like. It's a larger space than you'd expect. 

On this weekday the place had a light crowd and the morning light was soothing.

This is a fun garage turned restaurant bakery and breakfast spot in the kirkwood community. 
The decor was rustic and cute to go with the southern charm theme. 
The coffee options were really good and they serve all day brunch. I recommend the omelette with pimento. I love the spice and flavor of this dish. 
Great fast and friendly service.

I had not been here in years, since before the pandemic. It was absolutely lovely and delicious!!

I did not remember the lavender biscuits on the menu and how in the world could you not want to try one of those??!! I don't recall really reading the lavender, since I added the berry jam to my biscuit, which overshadowed the lavender flavor. Eggs were delish! My friend had the grits and said they were amazing!

We had lunch there on a Friday and it was wonderful and not crowded. I know there is a long wait on the weekends, but delightful during the week!

photos.caption: The scrambled eggs with Boursin cheese and a lavender biscuit! First thing on the menu.

comment.text: Came here with my husband and toddler on a Saturday morning and we were sat immediately. Our server was very sweet and quick. We ordered the french toast, kirkwood breakfast, cheesy grits, fruit bowl, and a side of potatoes. The french toast was great and came with fresh fruit on top. The kirkwood breakfast was ok, nothing too special. The cheesy grits were the best thing and super tasty! Potatoes were very bland. Great service. Plenty of seating inside but parking is very limited.

Came in on a Sunday morning a few months and I'm still thinking about this meal...

It was packed and busy but we were seated within a reasonable time frame, maybe a 10-15 minute wait? Ambience inside is cute and rustic. 

Ordered a hot latte, shrimp and grits, and lavender biscuit. My main issue with this place is there were too many things I wanted to order. I don't think there's anything you could get that wouldn't be good. Food was fresh and service was attentive and friendly. 

Will def be back and upset I hadn't been here sooner!

I was so disappointed. After following the reviews Injust knew this was going to be good. Unfortunately it was not. My dad and I both agreed the food was bland. The grapefruit mimosa was delicious! I didn't taste a lick of juice!! The service was great though. We were seated immediately, the food came quickly, and our server was attentive. My taste buds however, felt abused! lol! Granted everyone's taste buds are different but I cooked at the house! I won't be back.

photos.caption: Kirkwood breakfast with honey glazed bacon, potato hash, and scrambled egg whites

comment.text: Super cute establishment! The hostess greeted and seated me right away! Had a quick mimosa and i loved the trains driving by! I didnt get a chance to try the food but the menu looks amazing!

I had such an amazing experience here! I loved the atmosphere, service and food. 
I got the shrimp and grits and the other people I was with got their food and I got a bite of some of their food and it was delicious too. The staff is so friendly and helpful. They help with any questions pertaining the menu. I tried my partners coffee and it was yummy. They have selections of alternative milks and different drinks to try. Everyone dining in there looked so happy to be spending time in a safe space for anyone that enters.

David
Joined a friend late on Saturday afternoon for a late brunch. It's been a while since I've been here and I've been remiss.  

David was our server and he was very patient when we were indecisive and made some great suggestions.  I ended up with the pimento cheese omelette with a side of cheesy grits and my friend had the Hermes salad which was fresh and crisp with smoked salmon. We opted to split the French toast but honestly the portions are so generous we only took a bite. The food here is consistently delicious!! 
We also tried the sangria. Very nice also.  
This spot is a local favorite but even if you're not local make the trip!  You won't be disappointed. 

Side note:  the have a nice patio for outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Pimento Cheese Omelette with Cheese Grits

owner_replies.comment:
Glad you had a great time! Kristin is awesome!

- Michael/Sun in my Belly

comment.text: We came here fairly early on a Thursday morning, so it wasn't busy at all. There were a few groups of people scattered throughout, but we were seated in an area mostly to ourselves. Our waiter came quickly to take our orders. We've stopped by here once before years ago, and the menu has changed a bit. I ordered the Kirkwood Breakfast, which comes with scrambled eggs with Boursin cheese, a lavender biscuit, and your choice of meat. I usually eat chicken sausage since I don't eat pork often, but I opted for the regular bacon. (They also have a honey glazed bacon.) My husband didn't want much that morning, so he ordered the sriracha hummus plate and enjoyed it. I thought I'd love the Boursin cheese in the eggs, but it wasn't my favorite. I've only ever had one particular flavor and I love it, so I probably should've asked which flavor they use. Also, I couldn't taste any lavender in the lavender biscuit. It has little sprigs of lavender on top, but that's about all you get. My husband is an incredible cook and has his own lavender biscuit recipe that is phenomenal. I was excited to try theirs, but the flavor wasn't there at all. Just tasted like a regular biscuit. Overall, no complaints since I wanted something simple for breakfast. Just wish the flavors were enhanced a bit and that the type of Boursin was listed.

Nestled right next to the Marta tracks , this place is a hit or miss. I've come here once before with my parents, and we were delighted. This morning, the pimento cheese omelette was decadent, but the chicken sandwich left a lot to be desired. Refrigerated focaccia bread, non-dressed greens, overcooked chicken, and tasteless Mac and cheese. The service was solid, but they missed my side of lemons, after asking twice, I just gave up. The coffee here is solid though, enjoy a latte while you endure the 30-40 min wait time. Revolution donuts is 2 blocks away as well, if your sweet tooth is bothering you.

photos.caption: Pimento Cheese Omelette, Chicken Salad Sandwich

comment.text:
I searched for best Breakfast in Atlanta. This place came up on all the searches.  I was coming through Atlanta on the way home from work one morning so I decided to try it out.  Well the critics and lists were right!  Great breakfast spot! 

They have great outdoor or indoor seating. It was pretty slow that morning. But that equaled great service and super quick food.   I got the pimento cheese omelet and hash potatoes.  I did not need the ketchup I thought I may need for the potatoes.  They were very flavorful. not crispy but buttery smooth at least.  The omelet was fluffy and cooked perfectly. The  maple bacon or whatever and pimento cheese it was full of was very rich and delicious! 

Great service with some really good food. Great breakfast spot!

TL;DR: Sun In My Belly has a great shaded outdoor seating area, perfect for brunch. Limited parking, but plenty of street parking options. The Shrimp and Grits and French Toast were delicious. Service was lacking, with the server being mostly absent, and a mandatory 20% tip included in the check. Won't be going back due to the service and forced tip.

Sun In My Belly is a charming spot with a shaded outdoor seating area that's just perfect for enjoying a leisurely brunch. The weather was lovely, and the seating area had fans to keep us cool. It created a great atmosphere for a relaxing meal.

When it comes to parking, there's a small area behind the restaurant that can fit around 20 cars, but fear not! There's plenty of street parking available nearby, so finding a spot shouldn't be a hassle.

Now, onto the food! We ordered the Shrimp and Grits as well as the French Toast, and both dishes were absolutely delicious. The flavors were on point, and we thoroughly enjoyed every bite.

However, I have to admit that the service left a lot to be desired. Our server seemed to disappear after dropping off our food, only reappearing when it was time to hand us the check. To make matters worse, a 20% tip was automatically included in the bill. Frankly, the service didn't warrant such a high tip, and it's a shame that it was mandatory. Because of this, I don't think I'll be returning to Sun In My Belly.

I had an wonderful dining experience at Sun in My Belly. I arrived at around 2p.m. and was promptly seated. My server, Alek, was incredibly hospitable, which greatly enhanced the overall dining experience. For my meal, I chose the Kirkwood Breakfast, which included scrambled eggs with boursin cheese, a lavender biscuit, and honey-glazed bacon. The vibes is super cozy and provided the perfect setting for spending a relaxing Sunday afternoon.

Table for 2 for Breakfast
Approaching the restaurant, I noticed they had a very, very small parking lot behind the restaurant. Street parking was also available. Inside, we received a warm greeting and were seated in an ideal spot for a party of two. Our server promptly brought us water, and after a quick look at the drink menu, I went for a hot Chai Latte, while Wifey opted for a regular coffee. We needed a little more time to decide on our food.  By the time our server came back, we figured out what we wanted. I chose the Omelet of the Day, a chef's special with corn, red peppers, broccoli, and parmesan cheese, along with a side of honey bacon and a lavender biscuit. Wifey went for one of her favorites, Shrimp and Grits, paired with a side of pork sausage. The food arrived surprisingly fast.  I tasted my omelet and it was a little bland. I added some salt and pepper to spruce it up.  Also, I didn't really taste any honey on the honey bacon or any lavender in the lavender biscuit. Wifey enjoyed her Shrimp and Grits, but commented that the grits were salty. Overall, the food was OK.  Sun in my Belly is bigger than I expected with a bunch of indoor and outdoor seating, a nice cool casual vibe and ambiance.  We asked for the check and one togo box, wifey had enough Shrimp and Grits to take home. When the check arrived it seemed high.  After I inspected further, I saw the 20% gratuities were already added. Overall, we had a good experience. It is really a 3.5 rating, but the cool vibe and great service pushes it to a 4.

Dog Friendly 
Love the atmosphere 
Foods is delicious 
Variety on selection 
Great service 
I'm not a grits fan, but yum!!! I'll definitely order it again!
Eggs scrambled soft just like I like it !!!!
We love this place !!!!

The service and ambiance were good, but damn, this is one of the worst brunch food I've had in ATL area. The lavender biscuit has a hint of lavender taste, but it was dry and otherwise taste like instant store-bought or elementary school lunch biscuits. Breakfast sandwich and eggs were nothing special and very bland. The potatoes were soggy and bland. It was just one super bland meal with zero seasoning or flavor, and nothing tasted freshly made or had any uniqueness.

I enjoy the farmhouse vibe the restaurant has. Drinks are served in mason jars and the staff is able to wear clothes that match the vibe.
Sam was our server for the day and she provided great standard service. 

I ordered the Kirkwood Breakfast which though simple, comes with a deliciously amazing Lavender biscuit. I could literally eat a batch of those alone. I also tried a piece of my husband's Honey Glazed Bacon with I'll definitely be ordering next time I visit.
Yes the beacon egg n cheese panini is mmmmmmm DELICIOUS I be bussin that thing down every time and it definitely gets you full. Trust

I have to be honest and say that this 2 star rating is based on my personal preference when it comes to my style of dining. So when reading my review decide whether we're similar or different when considering being a customer for Sun In My Belly.

I ended up dining here due to the high rating and the food photography.

They have parking in-front of the business and a hectic small spaced parking in the back. (I'm unsure if it's for customers and employees or just employees)

Sun In My Belly gives an old home-felt diner vibe which I loved. Cake slices in the window set the tone.

Upon walking in there's a automatic 20% service charge regardless of the amount of ppl dining. (So per bill). I think this is insane especially if you were to dine alone. (I understand for situations with bigger parties or certain type of elite eating).

I ordered grits and shrimp with a side of pork sausage and a biscuit. The grits were good, I love to add sugar. The sausage gave me a "frozen sausage" vibe but it still tasted good. The shrimp was good but didn't fit the rest of the meal. The way it was seasoned gave a dinner vibe while eating a breakfast/brunch dish. (I'm very familiar with shrimp + grits and have ate it multiple ways so I did have a certain level of expectancy). 

The homemade biscuit was nice and came with what I perceived as homemade jam.

Overall I ate some of my grits, the sausages, a few shrimp and the inside of my biscuit. Majority of my meal remained on my plate. Not that it was nasty.. it just didn't go together well for me and I'm a very southern woman.

The size and cleanliness of the place definitely took away some stars. The wall I sat by was dirty and distracted me throughout dining.  My date ordered coffee which came with a dirty rim that we thought was stained. We learned differently when she wiped it and it came off on her finger).

For the 20% charge I'd expect top cleanliness & service (which was unremarkable).

photos.caption: (Biscuit, shrimp & grits, 2 pork sausages. ) Pork Sausage Cheese Grits Lavendar Biscuit

comment.text: The vibe feels like a country kitchen or farm to table. Fresh decor with all the bakery feels. Definitely makes you look forward to a hearty meal! The food was tasty including the lattes. Cleared the plate clean clean clean! The vegetarian options were decent. Our server was great and knew the menu really well so he gave good info so we could choose to suit our tastebuds. Service was quick and food was plated well! Definitely a return visit to this place!

Liked - Liked - Liked - Liked - Liked

Our waiter was nice enough


Disliked 
Nothing particularly stood out to me as far as flavor or experience. I wasn't completely happy or blown away by either of our meals. 

The candied bacon was absolutely not candied AT ALL. I almost feel like there had to be a mistake because there was no sweetness to our bacon. We showed them and they assured us it was sugared/candied but... I mean, that's something you can tell off the bat. So we just went with it but we weren't really happy about it .

We stopped by on a Sunday morning and were seated once our party arrived. It's a super cute restaurant and much bigger than it appears on the outside.

The food was descent. My eggs were under cooked and then over cooked. My husband enjoyed the French toast. The bacon was over cooked.

Their latte was the best part of the meal. No sugar required and not bitter at all.

We were first timers this morning and absolutely love the decor and service.  We ordered the shrimp and grits, and kirkwood breakfast (delicious).  Only thing I didn't like was they automatically added a 20% gratitude.  Usually gratitude is added to  a party of 8 or more.  I thought that was odd or was it just for us.  Not sure if I will return now.

I have had this restaurant bookmarked for over a year now. I had always heard great things about it and it clearly has wonderful reviews. Maybe I caught them on a bad day. I was at a site walk and afterwards my coworker wanted to have a late breakfast. I pulled up Yelp and low and behold sun in my belly was less than ten minutes away. When we arrived the place was packed but luckily the others waiting to be seated were larger parties so we only waited a few minutes before we sat down. The menu was predominantly breakfast with a few salads and sandwiches but I expected that. I decided to go with the PBLT and cheese grits. The sandwich consisted of pimento cheese, bacon, fried green tomato, lettuce with an aioli of some sort. I also opted to add the fried egg with an up charge. The menu read that it would be served on brioche but as you can see in the picture that was not the case. When I opened the sandwich I did rearrange it as it looked as though someone was extremely busy (which they were) and just threw it together. There was barely any aioli which made the sandwich very dry. The fried green tomato was hard. I know green tomatoes have a bite to them and I expected that but this tomato just wasn't ripe.  The brioche bread would've been much much better had they had it because again there was minimal aioli and pimento cheese on it, and the toast just was blah. I ended up just eating the bacon out of it. I scraped the small amount of pimento cheese and added to my cheese grits. The grits weren't bad but they weren't great either. I took a few bites and gave up. I basically paid $20.00 for four pieces of bacon and the fried egg I pulled off the sandwich. My coworker let me taste his sausage and gravy biscuits and they were hard, like they were day old. The gravy was ok but definitely forgettable. All in all, I left hungry and went to Chick Fil A for a grilled filet and scrambled eggs which I devoured. The restaurant was clean and the service was good as well however I will not be back for a second chance. If both dishes tasted were blah and lackluster, I simply can't justify spending money there once again when there are so many other places to try.

This place was amazing! I got the kirkwood breakfast and it was the perfect amount of food. The eggs were so fluffy and well seasoned, my favorite part of the breakfast. The lavender biscuit was also very tasty and flaky. Chicken sausage was great as well. I got the potatoes as well and it was good, but not extraordinary, I wouldn't get it again. But the highlight of this place for me was the lavender latte. This latte was the best lavender latte I've ever had. It wasn't too sweet and just the right amount of floral syrup. This place was amazing 10/10

We enjoyed our recent brunch at Sun in My Belly. All of the food we ordered was delicious and beautiful. The space was clean, neat and attractive. We were seated quickly but service was a little slow after that. It took us a long time to get our coffees and checks. Overall though, we were pleased and will certainly try it again.

We had a great brunch at Sun in My Belly on Saturday.

The ambiance was great and the service even better.  We arrived late for breakfast and early for lunch and were seated right away.  By the time we left the lunch crowd was coming in and a substantial line was forming.  There is quite a bit of seating and they can handle a pretty good crowd.  The service was not fast, but super attentive and it takes time to make things right.

Of course the most important part of any meal is the food, and Sun in My Belly did not disappoint.  It was really good.  I got the omelet of the day which included pulled pork, peppers and onions and was great.  My wife got the Demeter, a toasted sourdough sandwich with avocado spread, arugula, tomatoes, cucumbers, and lemon scented artichokes.  And the Demeter is even vegan.  My daughter got the PBLT, a pimento cheese BLT with fried green tomato.  Yes that is as good as it sounds.  We enjoyed the lavender biscuits and cheese grits as sides and cortado and chai latte beverages.  Everything was just great.

The only down side for me was that it was fairly pricy.  Our total was $62.98 for three people including coffees and tip.  Be aware the tip is already added to your bill so you don't need to add additional gratuity unless you want to.  I guess $20 apiece is not too much for a special occasion, but I could not make this an everyday place for breakfast.

photos.caption: "Omelet of the day" included pork, peppers, and onions, $12

comment.text: This appears to be a neighborhood spot.  The waiter and hostess were pleasant and attentive. I can't say I was blown away by the avocado toast as it was served on regular wheat bread and my drink was a little too strong. However, I did enjoy the Lucy Salad. I would recommend for a casual brunch or lunch if you're in the area.

We enjoyed our breakfast and the atmosphere at Sun in My Belly. Our boys had the shrimp and grits, and they enjoyed it. My husband had the Kirkwood Breakfast. The biscuits were very tasty and eggs had a yummy cheese. I had the PBLT which was amazing. The green tomatoes and pimento cheese gives this breakfast sandwich a unique taste. I can't wait to go back and get it again. I got the grits for my side and loved them. Everyone was very nice and helpful. Our waiter gave us great suggestions. Make sure your entire party is there as they wait to seat you until you all arrive which is typically in Atlanta.
Wow. I am blown away by the pimento cheese omelet. Their house lavender biscuit was also different but good. The potatoes were fine. Service was steady and our waiter was very attentive!

Went to Sun in my Belly for brunch , i was in the area and decided to stop by for some delicious food and mimosas. I ordered the shrimp and grits (side of chicken sausage) and came with a piece of focaccia bread and had 2 cranberry mimosas, delicious! My Mom had the kirkwood breakfast with scrambled eggs, lavender biscuit and honey bacon, she enjoyed it! Our waitress was awesome and because it was on Saturday it was a nuce crowd there and only had to wait for 15 minutes for a table! I love this spot, will be back soon! The parking is minimal, small lot in the back and some street parking. The ambiance was cool because it was a beautiful day and everyone was out enjoying themselves with good food and friends.

photos.caption: Shrimp and grits with chicken sausage, slice of focaccia toast, soooooooooooooo good
The lovely sweets ( I did not indulge this time)
Sun in my Belly Sign (families enjoying brunch)

comment.text:
I've had this place bookmarked on Yelp for nearly a year! My husband and I are so glad we finally made it in it over the weekend. The place is super cute, the staff is friendly, the service was solid, and the food was tasty!! 

Their patio is always awesome. It's super pet friendly (which we loveeee) and it's shaded. We'll so be back! I crave the arugula salad.

TERRIBLE TERRIBLE experience ! out of all the spots to eat i had to choose the worst one of them all and on my birthday at that. This place is racist!

I walked in and got seated for a table of one. i was only given silverware and a menu. I sat at the table for about 5-7 mins and still wasn't greeted by anybody. The waitress even walked to the area to check on the table next to me and still didn't greet me.

Now i've been sitting for about 15 mins when a caucasian woman walks in and the same guy who sat me gives the girl options on what table she wants to sit at and ALSO brings her a glass of water. Then within 5 mins of her being there the waitress comes and takes her order while I'M STILL SITTING THERE. It was like I was invisible to them. When I got up and brought to the guy who sat me attention all he said was "oh my bad". Please if ya african american, don't waste ya time or money at this establishment!!! I don't even write reviews but they needed they asses cursed out. I took the civilized route.

The food was so good and well made. The service was so nice and helpful. It was a little loud inside but very casual. Outside seating was dog friendly. There is free parking in the back of the restaurant but the parking lot is small. There should be street parking though.

photos.caption: Croque Monsieur with Caesar salad side

comment.text: Amazing portion sizes for both the main and the sides; each item is around $13 and comes with a really big side, like the hashed potatoes were a side for my croque monsieur. The flavors were all bomb. The croque monsieur was drenched in the bechmel sauce but was still crispy, and the fried green tomatoes were INSANE. Amazing presentation and flavor and crunch. Pretty decent service, though we went during a non busy time. Don't sit outside as it's right by a busy road.

photos.caption: Pimento Cheese Omelette, fried green tomatoes

comment.text: I wasn't blown away here, but the meal didn't leave upset about it. Most of what I had needed something extra. The brussel sprout slaw was the only item I'd love to try again. The cuban sandwich tasted like any other with toasted bread, and the fried green tomatoes were bland. The drink wasn't that strong either. My brother had a different sandwich, a PBLT, that he said was delicious. Wish I had made that choice. They also had a chocolate parfait I could give a go at again. The service was amiable, and the atmosphere was cozy. I might try them out once more, but'll definitely order something different.

photos.caption: Lavender biscuit, brussel sprout slaw, and sandwich PBLT
Fried green tomatoes, brussel sprout slaw, and Cuban sandwich.

comment.text:
My friend and I came here for breakfast on a Sunday and it is just the cutest place! We love the decor and it is a much bigger restaurant than we expected, with plenty of seating indoors and outdoors.

Our server was extremely kind and attentive and our food came out much quicker than we expected despite there being so many people already there for breakfast. I ordered the omelette of the day and honestly, I wasn't expecting much because omelettes usually all taste the same to me. However I really enjoyed mine and my friend who got the pimento cheese omelette said hers had a very unique flavor which she really liked! The lavender biscuit was our favorite! Such a soft biscuit with a beautiful flavor. We also couldn't help get a French toast as part of our "breakfast dessert". This was absolutely divine and not too sweet (we're not fans of overly sweet breakfast items). 

The only downside is that parking is a little bit difficult. There is a small lot that can hold maybe about 10 cars but you'll likely have to find some street parking in the neighborhood. Granted, it wasn't too difficult but just keep that in mind when you're going in during the busiest times. By the time we were leaving the restaurant, it was 11 AM on a Sunday and there were many many people waiting outside. 

Will definitely be going back to try out more items on the menu!!

photos.caption: Omelette of the Day with a lace Dar biscuit

comment.text:
Been here twice now and happy as a clam. Would 100% recommend. Would 1000% come back. The restaurant itself is snug , a little tight , but it's comfy and there's indoor and outdoor seating.  
The service is nice no complaints. They are very busy on the weekends and 20% gratuity is automatically added so hopefully it's always good. 
But the real star is the food. I love breakfast so I'm so happy here. I could move in everything is delicious. My favorite shrimp and grits in the city.

photos.caption: Shrimp and grits with a side of eggs over easy and chicken sausage

comment.text:
Breakfast...meal of champions! Stopped by Sun in my belly, In the Kirkwood neighborhood on my way into the city for some quick morning fuel. What I thought would be a small breakfast and brunch spot turned out to be a massive open restaurant with multiple dining rooms, including an outdoor space. 

I went for the appropriately named kirkwood breakfast. It may look like an uninspiring egg biscuit and bacon plate, but looks can be deceiving my friend. Honey glazed bacon, a fluffy lavender biscuit, and scrambled eggs featuring Boursin cheese. Sun in my belly has taken a simple breakfast dish and elevated it to complex culinary heights. 

Creativity simply cannot be taught....when you have, you have it. Sun in my belly has got it. Can't wait to go back and try the rest of the menu!

Hermes salad is so flavorful. Scrambled eggs with Boursin was yummy, vegetarian "sausage" was great. Lavender biscuit was good. 

No complaints. We got takeout, and everything was packaged well and stayed warm.

This was an awesome brunch spot! The mimosas were all champagne with a splash of orange juice! The fried green tomatoes were amazing!  The service was great and the inside was so cute! I'd definitely come here for another brunch!

photos.caption: Omelette of the day with brussel sprout slaw-so yummy!

comment.text: Sorely disappointed, surprised the reviews are as good as they are. I was really wanting to like this place but the food was a major let down. Avocado toast was sad - thinly spread avocado on some basic toasted bread. Breakfast panini also nothing to write home about, grits were ok. Scrambled eggs are lazy. Automatic 20% gratuity to every order? Come on, at least earn it. Overrated for sure. Especially with how many great brunch options there are in Atlanta, you're better suited elsewhere.

Came in the day before New Year's Eve and was able to be seated during lunch hour with only a 15 minute wait. The menu is straightforward but has something for everyone. The food came out quickly, and every item was delicious! The eggs on the kirkwood breakfast were the standout, as they were silky and perfectly cooked. The veggie sausage and biscuit were also notable!

Don't sleep on this hidden gem i had the chance to try this restaurant out for breakfast/brunch this week an it was a pretty nice little library kinda vibe lol it was a nice little spot very peaceful and kinda fast as well they had a pretty decent selection of food here for breakfast that we actually enjoyed it was worth the 45 wait. 

Food 6/10 
Basic drink 3/10 
Shrimp and Grits my friend said a 7/10 
Pita bread sandwich 7/10 
Ambiance simple but cute library coffee shop vibes

photos.caption: My friends food Shrimp and Cheese Grits
Egg white , sweet Tea , purple bread i think that's what it was called
One side of the bar area
What i had idk why i keep saying pita lol

comment.text:
We enjoyed our breakfast here. There are option of sitting outside and even though it was a Friday morning in July, it was very pleasant sitting outside.service is quick  and friendly. Food is flavorful and tasty. 
We ordered coffee, shrimp and grits green fried tomatoes and lavender biscuit. Everything was great. 

There is parking behind the restaurant, be advise to not leave ANYTHING in the car. While we were enjoying our breakfast, one car was broken into and a backpack with a computer was stolen.

This place is such a vibe. It's a cool casual brunch spot in Decatur with decent side street parking (and a lot behind). Our server Tyler was helpful, attentive without being intrusive, and kind. I got the mimosa (tasty, heavy on the champs, $8) and the Kirkwood breakfast with added gravy. This includes soft scrambled eggs with Boursin cheese, your choice of meat (I got honey bacon), and a Lavendar biscuit. It was all DELICIOUS. The lavendar biscuit, combined with the béchamel black pepper gravy was excellent, but I liked also having the eggs and bacon. Will absolutely be back.

Wow blown away by service here!! Got shrimp and grits which were pretty good! Martin was so helpful and kind, fixed any errors immediately and made sure we were taken care. the outside seating was also pleasant, beautiful ambiance
Love the vibe and food and service here. A perfect casual restaurant experience. Great coffee and baked goods too!!
I will be coming back. The menu was for me the perfect breakfast spot. Use to NYC quality brunches, so this matched up.

photos.caption: Two orders: Avocado toast and lox and bagel
